newsitem.title: USA: United Intl in deal over New Zealand unit.
newsitem.headline: United Intl in deal over New Zealand unit.

text.p: United International Holdings Inc said Wednesday it has sold a 35 percent stake in its New Zealand cable television and telephone service unit to a division of Canada's Saskatchewan Telecommunications.

The deal calls for SaskTel International to invest about $20 million in United International's Saturn Communications Ltd upon closing of the deal, United International said. Other terms were not disclosed.

"SaskTel brings valuable telephony expertise to Saturn as we migrate our business in New Zealand from a pure video operation to an integrated cable-telephony service," United International chairman and chief executive officer Gene Schneider said in a statement.
Saturn will continue to operate as a majority-owned unit of United International's regional operating unit, UIH Asia/Pacific Communications Inc.
